com.github.davidmoten.reels.internal

Class ActorRefImpl<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.davidmoten.reels.internal.ActorRefImpl<T>

extends Object
implements SupervisedActorRef<T>, Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef
        Sends a Poison Pill message to the actor which will be stopped when that message is processed. The Poison Pill message does not jump the queue past other already waiting messages on the Actor.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ActorRef<T>

      • stopNow

        public void stopNow()
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef
        Sends a Poison Pill message to the actor which will be stopped when that message is processed. All messages before it in the queue are removed from the queue and sent to the Dead Letter actor so the Poison Pill message effectively jumps the queue.
        Specified by:
        stopNow in interface ActorRef<T>

        public void stopNowThis()

      • restart

        public boolean restart()
        Description copied from interface: SupervisedActorRef
        Recreates the Actor object that processes messages on the next message polled from the queue (mailbox). Should be called synchronously from the Supervisor object.
        Specified by:
        restart in interface SupervisedActorRef<T>
        Returns:
        true if and only if command accepted (for example if actor disposed or stopped then won't be accepted)

      • pause

        public boolean pause(long duration,
                     TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: SupervisedActorRef
        Pauses message processing for the given duration.

        Note especially that it is a good idea to keep the delay short because a graceful shutdown of actors (via Context.shutdownGracefully() will have to wait for the actor to be unpaused (to process the stop message).

        Specified by:
        pause in interface SupervisedActorRef<T>
        Parameters:
        duration - duration of pause
        unit - duration unit
        Returns:
        true if and only if command accepted (for example if actor disposed or stopped then won't be accepted)

      • pauseAndRestart

        public boolean pauseAndRestart(long delay,
                               TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: SupervisedActorRef
        Will restart the actor after the given given delay on the next message polled from the queue (mailbox). Until that time the actor is in a paused state and no messages will be processed (messages will be buffered in-memory). Once restarted message processing resumes.

        Note especially that it is a good idea to keep the delay short because a graceful shutdown of actors (via Context.shutdownGracefully() will have to wait for the actor to be unpaused (to process the stop message).

        Specified by:
        pauseAndRestart in interface SupervisedActorRef<T>
        Parameters:
        delay - time till restart called
        unit - duration unit
        Returns:
        true if and only if command accepted (for example if actor disposed or stopped then won't be accepted)

      • ask

        public <S> CompletableFuture<S> ask(T message)
        Description copied from interface: ActorRef
        Creates a temporary actor that sends the message to this and the returned CompletableFuture waits on a response. The arrival of the response to the Future or a timeout on CompletableFuture.get also disposes the temporary actor as does cancelling the Future.
        Specified by:
        ask in interface ActorRef<T>
        Type Parameters:
        S - type of response
        Parameters:
        message - message to send to this
        Returns:
        future
